data.text:
Associated Students (AS) is the student government of Cypress College. AS offers students the opportunity to gain unique leadership skills as well as personal and professional development. Just as Cypress College is a leading, premiere community college in California, our student government strives to live up to the same level of distinction by upholding and advancing our institution’s core values of equity, excellence, collegiality, inclusiveness, and integrity. The council focus is also on representing and advocating for our fellow students on campus, regional and state levels. This is established by having student representatives serving on our college shared governance committees, having a student trustee representation, designated regional delegate and participation at the annual state level General Assembly.

The AS Benefits Fee ($13) funds all AS business and operations at Cypress College. These funds allow AS to host activities and events for Cypress College students and fund club grants, student-oriented initiatives, scholarships, and general improvements to student life/resources.

Anyone can pay this fee to join the AS Benefits Program upon registration each semester or at the Bursar’s Office on-campus. AS Benefits Member cards can be picked up at Admissions and Records.

TicketsatWork Membership

Cypress College students are eligible to sign-up to participate in our partnership with TicketsatWork. With membership, students gain access to exclusive discounts on electronics, appliances, theme park admission, hotels, movie tickets, gift cards, apparel, flowers, fitness memberships, cars, groceries, special events, and more!

By opting into our AS Benefits Program each semester, students help our organization maintain this partnership which provides our campus community with a wide array of special perks and savings.

To sign-up:

Visit TicketsatWork.com

Click Become a Member

Sign up using our college code: KBFCC This benefit also extends to friends and family members! Simply share our college code with them so they can join.

Exclusive AS Benefits Member Discounts

Please email studentlife@cypresscollege.edu for any inquiries related to the AS Benefits Program.

Associated Students values the diverse perspectives of students at our institution, and actively listening to and understanding these perspectives better informs the Council what student needs merit increased attention. To better achieve this, AS intermittently hosts Town Halls throughout the academic year to solicit student feedback on a variety of topics related to Cypress College and the student body. The AS Council will take all feedback received into consideration when serving in all relevant representative capacities on behalf of the student body.

To stay informed on any upcoming Town Halls this academic year, please follow Associated Students on Instagram @Cypress_AS
